author: Staff Reporter
text:
Celebration of women — that seemed to be the theme during the inauguration of C.P. Art Centre’s Annual Women’s Craft Bazaar held here on Tuesday.

This year, Bargavi Devendra, honorary secretary of C.P. Ramaswami Aiyar Foundation, and P. Priyamvatha of News X Channel were presented the ‘Golden Jubilee Woman Achiever Award’ by foundation.

Ms. Devendra said that though women had accomplished great things, recent trends in the way women were being treated were indeed disturbing.

“When we open newspapers, we see various atrocities women are subjected to — this must stop. We must start counselling women at an early age and there must be counsellors in school to help children out in case of any such problems,” she said.

Actor and dancer Vyjayanthimala Bali said reformers in the past had done so much for the uplift of women.

“Nothing ever comes without hard work. Women who have succeeded have earned every bit of their success with incredible hard work,” she added.

Nanditha Krishna of the foundation said the crafts bazaar had, over the years, been ‘of the women, for the women and by the women’.

“I have seen several of them come with tragic stories and they have since grown and emerged out as successful poeple. They stand as an inspiring,” she added.

Recent trends in the way women were being treated were disturbing, said Bargavi Devendra
title: Achievers honoured
